name: theism
content:

belief in the existence of a god or gods, especially a god who created the world and who acts to influence events: Russell, the famous philosopher, rejected theism on the grounds that it can be neither proven nor disproven that God exists. By theism I mean the view that there is an omniscient (all-knowing), omnipotent (all-powerful), good being who has created the universe. Compare
atheism
deism
monotheism
pantheism
polytheism
More examplesFewer examplesIt is no easy task to define the different forms of theism and atheism.Darwin himself was unwilling to reject theism openly.He did not convert to traditional biblical theism, but he no longer defended dogmatic atheism.
